solution.text:
Area of tin sheet required for 1 box = Surface area of one box
\(= 2 (6 \times 3 + 3 \times 3 + 6 \times 3) = 90 cm^2\)
Therefore, area of tin required for 13 boxes \(= 90 \times 13\)
\(= 1170 cm^2\)

content.text: You need to create a tin box of dimensions \(6 cm \times 3 cm \times 3 cm.\) What is the area of a sheet of tin required to make 13 such tins?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area of the box

solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (29 \times 11 + 11 \times 11 + 29 \times 11) = 1518 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 2.2 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(1518 \times 2.2\)
= Rs. 3339.6

content.text: Latika needs to paint a rectangular box from the outside. The cost of painting the box is Rs. 2.2 per \(cm^2.\) If the dimensions of the box are \(29 cm \times 11 cm \times 11 cm\), what is the total cost of painting the box?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 1664 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(1664 m^2\)
Therefore, \(1664 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{1664}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{16}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 4 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

solution.text:
Curved Surface area of the roller \(= 2 \pi rh = 2\pi \times \frac {5}2 \times 32 = 502.86 cm^2\)
Area covered per rotation \(= 502.86 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area painted in 57 rolls \(= 502.86 \times 57 = 28662.86 cm^2\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is 32 cm and its diameter is 5 cm. While painting, the roller rolled over 57 times completely. What surface area did Ram paint?

hint.text: How much area does the roller cover in one rotation?

solution.text: Surface Area of a cube = \(6 \times length^2 = 24 cm^2\)

solution.text: Surface Area of a cuboid = \(2(ab + bc + ca) = 2 (112.5 + 37.5 + 75) = 450 dm^2\)

content.text: See the cuboid below, a=15 dm, b=7.5 dm, c=5 dm, Find its surface area

solution.text: Surface Area of a cylinder = \(2 \times \pi \times r \times(r + h) = 1584 cm^2\)

content.text: In the cylinder below, diameter=28 cm, h=4 cm, find its surface area

solution.text:
Surface Area = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2\pi ({r_ o}^2 - {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 528 + 264 + 75.43 = 867.43 cm^2\)

content.text: In the hollow cylinder below, Inner Radius =2 cm, Outer Radius = 4 cm, Height = 21 cm, find its surface area
Find the surface area of the objects below:

hint.text:
Remember the following formulas:
Surface Area of the Cube:\( 6 \times side^2\)
Surface Area of the Cuboid: \(2 \times (lb + bh + lh)\)
Surface area of a cylinder:\(2\pi r(r+h)\)

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 2.7^2 = 218.7 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(2.7^2 cm^2 = 7.29 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 218.7 - 72.9 = 145.8 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 8 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(145.8 \times 8\)
= Rs. 1166.4

content.text: Five cubes of edge 2.7 cm each are placed side by side and stuck together as shown. The cost of painting is Rs 8 per \(cm^2\). What is the cost of painting the outer surface of the entire object?

hint.text: Count the number of faces that are outward facing

solution.text:
Total surface area \(= 486= 6 (side)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Length of side = \( \left(\sqrt {\frac {486}{6}} \right) = 9 cm\)

content.text: A closed box in the shape of a cube has a total outer surface area of 486 \(cm^2.\) What is the length of its side in centimetres?

hint.text: Remember that surface area of a cube is \(6 \times side^2\)
